did.unittitle: Wagner Free Institute of Science director's files

bioghist.p: Incorporated by William Wagner in 1855, the Wagner Free Institute is a natural history museum and educational institution in Philadelphia that is dedicated to providing free public education in the sciences. William Wagner originally offered free lectures and classes in his home and at Spring Garden Hall. He later constructed an Institute building, which opened to the public in 1865.

scopecontent.p: This collection is an assortment of records relating to the Wagner Free Institute of Science from 1856 to 1883, including bills, receipts, a rent collection list, correspondence, notes, clippings, a letter to trustees, and an 1856 printed announcement seeking donations and exchanges.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
